intro: Saccolabium chrysoplectrum, commonly known as the golden cup-millet, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences, which are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Saccolabium chrysoplectrum is also known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
